definition: scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
light/easy/gentle/soft/reckless/unimportant/frivolous/small in number/unstressed/neutral/to disparage

sentences.english: The phenomenon men of letters tend to despise one another of srpeaded invisibly.
sentences.chinese: 無形之中使文人相輕的現象蔓延了。

sentences.english: The fact that most men of letters despise each other may result from their jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 文人相輕很可能源自於文人之間的互相嫉妒。

sentences.english: I considered that of all ages literati despised each other.
sentences.chinese: 認爲是文人相輕自古皆然的事。

definition: to persist in one's views
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to display one's slight skill before an expert (idiom)
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
incurable/incorrigible/beyond cure/hopeless
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
to exaggerate
to weigh up sb's words and observe their facial expression (idiom)/to discern what sb thinks from his body language
sequel/continuation of a book
protective coloration/camouflage
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
